meanings.definition: The female reproductive organs of a flower.
meanings.sent1: The gynoecia of the flower contain the ovules.
meanings.sent2: Bees are attracted to the gynoecia of the flower for pollination.
meanings.sent3: The gynoecia of the flower were having a party, inviting all the pollen grains.
meanings.sent4: Her garden bloomed with gynoecia, each one a delicate treasure.
meanings.sent5: The gynoecia, like tiny treasure chests, held the future of the plant.

meanings.definition: The pistil or pistils of a flower considered as a group.
meanings.sent1: The gynoecia of the daisy stood tall in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: She carefully examined the gynoecia of each flower in the bouquet.
meanings.sent3: The gynoecia of the garden seemed to gossip among themselves.
meanings.sent4: In the field, the gynoecia swayed gently in the breeze like a chorus line.
meanings.sent5: The gynoecia, standing together, formed a beautiful floral orchestra.
